title: Sheet Pan Smoked Sausage, Apple, and Root Veggie Dinner Recipe
description: This easy sheet pan meal with smoked sausage, apple, Brussels sprouts, and carrots is a quick and comforting meal to enjoy during the cooler months.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Hillshire Farm® Sheet Pan Smoked Sausage, Apple, and Root Veggie Dinner 4.8 (164) 129 Reviews 45 Photos This easy sheet pan meal featuring the smoked sausage flavor you love paired with your favorite winter produce, like apples and root veggies, was created in partnership with Hillshire Farm Brand. Submitted by Hillshire FarmR Brand Updated on August 7, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 45 45 45 45 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 8 ounces baby carrots 8 ounces Brussels sprouts, halved lengthwise 1 small red onion, peeled and cut into 8 wedges 3 tablespoons olive oil 2 teaspoons chopped fresh rosemary 1 teaspoon kosher salt ½ teaspoon black pepper 1 (12 ounce) package Hillshire Farm Rope Smoked Sausage, cut in 1/2" bias-cut slices 1 medium Honeycrisp apple, cut into 12 wedges 1 lemon, halved 2 tablespoons chopped parsley Directions Place a large baking pan in the oven. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (232 degrees C). Toss together carrots, Brussels sprouts, onion, olive oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper in a large bowl until combined. Arrange vegetable mixture and sausage in a single layer on the preheated pan. Bake in the preheated oven until just tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven. Turn the broiler to high. Add apple to the pan; broil until apple is tender and vegetables are slightly caramelized, 5 to 6 minutes. Remove from the oven, squeeze lemon over vegetable mixture in the pan, and sprinkle with parsley. I Made It Print 347 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 435 Calories 35g Fat 24g Carbs 14g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 435 % Daily Value * Total Fat 35g 44% Saturated Fat 9g 45% Cholesterol 53mg 18% Sodium 1306mg 57% Total Carbohydrate 24g 9% Dietary Fiber 8g 28% Total Sugars 10g Protein 14g 27% Vitamin C 75mg 84% Calcium 69mg 5% Iron 2mg 10% Potassium 468mg 10% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sheet Pan Smoked Sausage, Apple, and Root Veggie Dinner 01 of 45 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 45 Photo by  Shawanda Barnes 01/06/2023 I didn't have apples but I will next time. This is going in my recipe box for sure. This was quick and easy.. I used chicken sausage and beef sausage. 03 of 45 Photo by  Rc Sanders 05/05/2021 04 of 45 Photo by  Rc Sanders 05/05/2021 05 of 45 Photo by  Brenda John Kilgour 11/05/2020 06 of 45 Photo by  back2000 04/17/2020 I used apple chicken sausage and I had some sweet potatoes on hand so I used those instead of carrots. I love the flavor of rosemary so I added extra. The flavors taste so good together! I will be making this again! 07 of 45 Photo by  JARRIE 03/28/2020 This was good. There was nothing notably outstanding about it in particular, but we all enjoyed it. I thought the apples could do with a bit more cooking for our family's tastes but that probably varies a lot by type of apple. Thanks for sharing! 08 of 45 Photo by  Howard 03/28/2020 Quick and easy dinner that really delivers a nice assortment of flavors. Everyone loved it, the lemon gave it a nice pop! 09 of 45 Photo by  Rae 03/27/2020 This was delicious. I added potatoes to the veggies. my husband who hates brussel sprouts said they weren't bad this way. I did have to use dried rosemary and skipped the parsley since I couldn't find any. Really enjoyed the sweetness from the apple 10 of 45 Photo by  Cooking Daddy 03/27/2020 We really loved this recipe. It's so quick and easy to make. Its a delicious recipe with the addition of the apples. Just remember that if you replace any of the veggies with another that the cook time might be different. We used yams, and they took much longer. The sausage cooked a little too long because of them. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Smoked Sausage Stackers with Honey Mustard Sauce 11 Ratings Autumn Ratatouille with Hillshire Farm Smoked Sausage 19 Ratings Smoked Sausage, Pumpkin, and Collard Greens Lasagna 5 Ratings Smoked Sausage and Cauliflower Fried Rice 37 Ratings Hillshire Farm Smoked Sausage and Brussels Sprout Salad 11 Ratings Smoked Sausage with Potatoes, Sauerkraut & Ale 82 Ratings Smoked Sausage and Tortellini Skillet 80 Ratings Sheet Pan Pizza with Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage & Burst Cherry Tomatoes 7 Ratings Cowboy Pie 18 Ratings Classic Smoked Sausage & Peppers 96 Ratings Smoked Sausage and Tortellini Soup 110 Ratings Baked Penne and Smoked Sausage 134 Ratings Smokey Sausage, Kale & Sweet Potato Soup 90 Ratings Pesto Spaghetti Squash Skillet with Hillshire Farm Smoked Sausage 40 Ratings Cauliflower-Crusted Quiche with Hillshire Farm® Smoked Sausage 21 Ratings Smoked Sausage and Butternut Squash Pasta 26 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Arrange vegetable mixture and sausage in a single layer on the preheated pan.;Bake in the preheated oven until just tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from the oven.;Turn the broiler to high.;Add apple to the pan; broil until apple is tender and vegetables are slightly caramelized, 5 to 6 minutes. Remove from the oven, squeeze lemon over vegetable mixture in the pan, and sprinkle with parsley.
